dict.string: ⌘ ⌥: Add page number & then add another citation
Cite in and convert Markdown files to .docx, .pdf, .odt, .html, or .pptx with proper citations & bibliography
Pandoc-Suite and BibTeX-Zotero-Citation-Picker for Academic Writing in Markdown

export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
citekey="{query}" bibfile=~`echo -n $bibtex_library_path | sed -e "s/~//"` csl=~`echo -n $csl_file | sed -e "s/~//"` dummyBib="---
nocite: |
 "$citekey"
---
::: {#refs}
:::"
echo -n $dummyBib | pandoc --citeproc --read=markdown --write=plain --csl $csl --bibliography $bibfile | tr "
" " "

-- this script puts the app into foreground that was in focus when the hotkey was triggered. -- this allows the following clipboard action later on to automatically paste the input into the app
on run
set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate --note: alfreds focused-app-variable passes not an app name, but the app-id, therefore they keyword "id" has to be added here. return "{query}" --passes through the query
end run
if application "Zotero" is running then return "true" else return "false" end if

-- for whatever reason this Applescript does not work properly when combined with the previous one into one script.
on run
display notification "Citation Picker will appear in a moment" with title "⏳ Starting Zotero..." tell application "Zotero" to activate
set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate
delay 1
end run

⚠️ Atom is open, but no file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

if (system attribute "focusedapp") is "md.obsidian" then tell application "Obsidian" open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=open-with%253Ashow-file-in-explorer" open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=open-with-default-app%253Ashow" end tell delay 0.8 end if
tell application "Finder" to set sel to selection if ((count sel) > 1) then set firstItem to item 1 of sel return POSIX path of (firstItem as text) else return POSIX path of (sel as text) end if

⚠️ No file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

⚠️ The selected file does not seem to be a Markdown file. Please select a markdown file and try again.
'{query}'

⚠️ No PDF Engine set.
You have to set a PDF engine before using "pdf" as output format. You can do sp by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "PDF-Engine".

⚠️ You have not selected a BibTeX-Library.
You can do that by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "BibTeX Library".
tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to remove configuration "output_file" in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid")

# on the pdflatex location, see: https://superuser.com/questions/1038612/where-do-i-get-the-pdflatex-program-for-mac # further path additions as pandoc is installed a different location for ARM Macs
export PATH=/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/texlive/:/Library/TeX/texbin/:/opt/homebrew/bin/:$PATH
{query}
# Reveal in Finder if [[ "$open_after" == "true" ]] ; then open --reveal "$output_file" open "$output_file" else open --reveal "$output_file" fi

#!/usr/bin/env osascript --pandoc command construction
on run
--import environment variables (Shell Script part necessary to handle encoding, see https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/15992-applescript-reads-alfred-environment-variables-in-wrong-encoding/ set csl_file to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "csl_file") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set bibtex_library_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "bibtex_library_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_docx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_docx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_pptx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_pptx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set further_pandoc_args to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "further_pandoc_args") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set second_library to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "second_library") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set resource_path_subfolder to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "resource_path_subfolder") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" -- these omit the shell script detour as they will only have preset values without special characters set pdf_engine to (system attribute "pdf_engine") set desired_format to (system attribute "desired_format") set slide_level to (system attribute "slide_level")
--split doc_path into parent_folder and doc_name set doc_path to "{query}" set doc_name to doc_path repeat while (offset of "/" in doc_name) > 0 --loop checks whether a Slash is still in the string set doc_name to text ((offset of "/" in doc_name) + 1) thru -1 of doc_name end repeat set parent_folder to text 1 thru -(1 + (length of doc_name)) of doc_path set resource_path_subfolder (to parent_folder & resource_path_subfolder & "/")
--removes common Markdown file extensions from the doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".md" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdtxt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".markdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".Rmd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mkd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdwn" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".txt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name
-- ARM workaround, see https://groups.google.com/g/pandoc-discuss/c/tWWIEgW94U0/m/yKMfldtYBgAJ?pli=1 if (pdf_engine is "pdflatex-arm") then set pdf_engine to "/Library/TeX/texbin/pdflatex"
-- building the elements of the pandoc command set bibliography to "" set bibliography2 to "" set reference_docx to "" set pdf_arg to "" set reference_pptx to "" set second_ressource_path to ""
set input to (quoted form of doc_path) & " " set output to "-o " & (quoted form of (parent_folder & doc_name & "." & desired_format)) & " " set resource_path to "--resource-path=" & (quoted form of parent_folder) & " " if bibtex_library_path ≠ "" then set bibliography to "--bibliography " & (quoted form of bibtex_library_path) & " " if second_library ≠ "" then set bibliography2 to "--bibliography " & (quoted form of second_library) & " " set citation_style to "--csl " & (quoted form of csl_file) & " " set slide_level_arg to "--slide-level=" & slide_level & " " set further_args to further_pandoc_args & " " if reference_docx_path ≠ "" then set reference_docx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_docx_path) & " " if reference_pptx_path ≠ "" then set reference_pptx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_pptx_path) & " " if pdf_engine ≠ "" then set pdf_arg to "--pdf-engine=" & pdf_engine & " " if resource_path_subfolder ≠ "" then set second_ressource_path to "--resource-path=" & (quoted form of parent_folder) & " "
-- modifies command based on desired output format set pandoc_command to ("pandoc " & input & output & "--citeproc --metadata link-citations=true " & resource_path & second_ressource_path & bibliography & bibliography2 & citation_style & further_args) if desired_format = "docx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_docx) if desired_format = "pdf" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & pdf_arg) if desired_format = "html" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & "--standalone ") if desired_format = "pptx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_pptx & slide_level_arg) set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & " 2>&1")
-- returns the pandoc-command to Alfred to process it as bash script return pandoc_command end run

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred/main/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred' readonly download_type='github_release' readonly frequency_check='1'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type d -name 'Notificator.app')" if [[ -n "${notificator}" ]]; then "${notificator}/Contents/Resources/Scripts/notificator" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
local -r terminal_notifier="$(find . -type f -name 'terminal-notifier')" if [[ -n "${terminal_notifier}" ]]; then "${terminal_notifier}" -title "${alfred_workflow_name}" -subtitle 'A new version is available' -message "${1}" return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download page…' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
download_url="$([[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]] && curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest" | grep 'browser_download_url' | head -1 | sed -E 's/.*browser_download_url": "(.*)"/\1/' || echo "${workflow_url}")"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installing…' curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi
Sets the Output Format for the Hotkey
Press [space] to view a list of the last modified .docx Files.
Press [space] to view a list of the last modified .odt Files.
Press [space] to view a list of recently modified .pptx Files.

[{"title":"📕 Zotero Citation Picker (classic)","arg":"Zotero","subtitle":"uses native Zotero GUI (Zotero must be installed)"},{"title":"🎩 Alfred Citation Picker (alternative)","arg":"Alfred","subtitle":"uses Alfred as GUI, works directly on BibTeX Library"}]
(Any file in the same directory as the Markdown file will also be used.)
Name of folder (must be in same directory as .md file): '{query}'

[{"title":"📅 Normal Date Format","arg":"normal","subtitle":"dd-mm-yyyy"},{"title":"🗓 American Date Format","arg":"american","subtitle":"mm-dd-yyyy"},{"title":"❌ Do not append any Date","arg":"none","subtitle":""}]
[{"title":"🔗 Create Automatic Hyperlinks","arg":"true","subtitle":"Citations to Bibliography & Bibliography to URLs"},{"title":"❌ No Automatic Links","arg":"false","subtitle":""}]
Select whether to create automatic links
Set additional options for the Pandoc Command
Displayed are the current extensions. Enter only extension, e.g. '+emoji'
Displayed are the current extensions. Enter only extension, e.g. '+emoji'
Displayed are the current filters. Enter only the filter names/paths, seperated by commata (,)
Press [space] to view a list of the last modified template files.
If there are no search results, go to "pconf" & select "Debugging: Deep Search Library File"
Search additional BibTeX Library. Press [Esc] to leave this setting empty and only use one library file.

[{"title":"✅ Open Output File after Conversion","arg":"true","subtitle":"with default application"},{"title":"❌ Do Open Output File after Conversion","arg":"false","subtitle":"only reveal it in Finder"}]

[{"title":"Slide-Level 0️⃣","arg":"0","subtitle":"'---' will be used as slide seperator"},{"title":"Slide-Level 1️⃣","arg":"1","subtitle":"H1 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 2️⃣","arg":"2","subtitle":"H2 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 3️⃣","arg":"3","subtitle":"H3 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 4️⃣","arg":"4","subtitle":"H4 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Consult Pandoc Manual on Slide Levels & Slide Structure","arg":"url","subtitle":"in the Pandoc documentation"}]
Set the Slide-Level for Conversions to Powerpoint
This may take up to a minute.

[{"title":"ℹ️ Information on PDF Engines","arg":"url","subtitle":"in the documentation"},{"title":"pdflatex (recommended)","arg":"pdflatex","subtitle":"Latex"},{"title":"pdflatex (M1 Macs)","arg":"pdflatex-arm","subtitle":"Workaround for ARM Macs"},{"title":"wkhtmltopdf (recommended)","arg":"wkhtmltopdf","subtitle":"HTML"},{"title":"pdfroff (recommended)","arg":"pdfroff","subtitle":"groff"},{"title":"prince","arg":"prince","subtitle":"HTML"},{"title":"tectonic","arg":"tectonic","subtitle":"self-contained Latex"},{"title":"weasyprint","arg":"weasyprint","subtitle":"HTML"},{"title":"context","arg":"context","subtitle":"Tex"},{"title":"lualatex","arg":"lualatex","subtitle":"Latex"},{"title":"xelatex","arg":"xelatex","subtitle":"Latex"},{"title":"latexmk","arg":"latexmk","subtitle":"Latex"}]
⚠️ This command only *selects* a PDF-Engine, is does not install it.
# idea from https://brettterpstra.com/2014/08/05/shell-tricks-man-pages/ man -t pandoc | open -f -a Preview

Documentation & Usage Guide =========================== ➡️ https://chris-grieser.de/pandoc_alfred
⚠️ After updating from 5.3.2 ============================================== You need to force reload the citaiton picer buffer (pconf ➞ reload) once after updating from 5.3.2 or below.

GREEN HOTKEY: Double-click to define
Trigger Pandoc Conversion

RED HOTKEY: Double-click to define
Citation Picker
also has to match "alternative" due to prior Citation Picker naming
if Zotero is not running, launch it
